Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Lialaa
Reviews.Content: Was on a short leisure trip to Berlin. This hotel was great. stayed in a single room 3rd floor, very modern, lovely bathroom with bath. Free safety deposit box in room,Two free internet computers in reception. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: As part of my Olympic trip in '04, decided to visit a friend in Germany who I was going to meet up with before heading back to Amsterdam for the flight back home. Since I was meeting up with her towards the end, decided I would check out the capital. Flew in to Berlin after a couple of weeks in Athens. Getting to know Berlin was a great little exercise in exploration. Tip: take advantage of the famous free Berlin tour. Arrived at Schoenefeld airport and took the AirportExpress train into the center of Berlin. From there got onto the S Bahn and got off at Zoo Garten stop and walked from there. First time there got a little lost. Went down the Kurfustendamm when I should have been looking for Kurfustenstrasse. Oh well. Anyway, found it and eventually found the hotel. The lobby was nice and large and the reception desk was to the left. To the right was an entrance to the next door restaurant. Check in was relatively easy. The young ladies working the front desk spoke broken english, but enough for us to understand each other. Got in a little early, but the room was ready so checked-in. Got the key and took off to my room on the 3rd floor. It was a standard room, which is the smallest one they have. It was simple and basic, but at least the bed was comfortable. Everything was clean so there were no complaints there. This is a quiet part of town and there are a few upscale hotels in the area as well. The best part is that it was a short walk to KaDeWe, which was a great experience of what department stores used to be like a long time ago. For the price, this place was hard to beat and even attempted the stay here the second time I was in Berlin, but they were completely booked, which was not a surprise. Next time I'll be sure to make a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyLife32
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and clean. the breakfast was also nice. I tried the lunch for two days, it was also very nice open buffet. it is located in the center close to a nice shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,I never forget it”
Reviews.Author: Mohammadreza1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 4,5 march 2012 (2 nights).It's Location is excellent ,I strongly suggest this Hotel First because of it's ideally location and second for it's very helpful staffs .Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very central location!”
Reviews.Author: Bmpaulsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weekend in January. We rented a suite and had a lot of space for the two of us.Nice and clean and a wonderful view over the roofs of Berlin. Berlin in very reasonable to eat and good tranportation all over the city. Helpful staff to all our questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Frb
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Sylter Hof last year in september. We stayed in a very large room with a great view of the city. Very helpful staff. Had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sylter Hof - Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Stuart049
Reviews.Content: Well located, nice food, friendly and clean. Close to the main shopping area, zoo and tube network. Staff were friendly and helpful and had a lovely stay. We used it for a short break in December and would happily do the same again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and the location, a great hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: djboro
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as part of an easyjet package, in March 2011, and went the week before Chrsitmas 2011 for four nights. Total price for two people flights and accomodation for four nights from Manchester 370 english pounds total... I thought a bargin. Breakfast is 10 euro extra... though, didnt use it even though it looked nice, as lots of nice cafes around hotel. We landed in Berlin Scefeild airport... which is about 18killometers from the centre of Berlin. We asked at airport information desk, and trains run dirrect into Berlin every 30minutes, the RE4 train. It cost 4 euro each one way, bargin better than paying 40 euros in a taxis. There is a 15 minute walk from the airport to train station, safe and eaily.... The train is dirrect into Zoo garchachter station, only three stops, and takes 30 minutes. Then you can either walk to the hotel which takes 15 minutes, or get 100 bus which pases, straight by station and takes you to hotel. The 100 bus runs day and most of night, and takes you to most of all the sites in Berlin.... costs 4 euros for a dialy ticket. The hotel is smart and business like, reception staff, and friendly speech english. The room had a large bath and shower above it, Mini bar in room. Which we emptied and filled with stuff we bought from the large NETTO straight over the road from the hotel..... Towels are changed everyday in hotel, but bedding every two days... The area of the hotel is fine..... felt safe walking at night.... yes there is massage palours around the hotel...... though area is good.. For the price and location would stay again.......... as public transport is good in Berlin.... If you liked walking it would take you 40 minutes to walk to the Brandonburg gate from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: silgamun
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights in this hotel. We had made our reservation through an web tool. The personnel was great and welcoming. Our room was excellent, great space, confortable bed, TV, phone, etc. The bathroom was very spacious, and extremely clean. Internet access is free in the lobby. The breakfast was included in the rate of the reservation, and it was a self-service, with big variety in fruits, breads, juices, etc Great location, with "bahn" and bus stations near.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money asked”
Reviews.Author: Golman
Reviews.Content: Good for business or sight seeing trips. Easy route to Shonfeld airport. However, it feels like it is placed in the middle of china quarter - food, massages etc. late evening walk wasn't comfy - the street is lighted poorly and hookers in dark corners .

Reviews.Title: “You won't find better at the price”
Reviews.Author: Barry Wood
Reviews.Content: Several other reviewers have made the same comments that I am going to make, but I'll add my thoughts anyway. This hotel does everything just about right. The staff are friendly and helpful. I was offered a map when I checked in, which was a good start, and they also sell the daily ticket for unlimited travel on buses and trains. Other things too, no doubt, such as the Berlin Card which I believe includes discounts for various attractions. I didn't get one so I'm not sure. It is worth staying at this hotel for the breakfast alone. It is superb with just about everything you could want. Again, the staff are very attentive and helpful, and the kitchen staff are always checking that items are not running out, in stark contrast to a hotel in my last review. The rooms. I had a small single, facing the street. This was not a problem in October, but you would need the windows open in summer and it would be noisy. You need to ask for a room at the back of the hotel. It would be nice if the hotel could at least provide a small fan in the room in summer. Perhaps they do. Heating was good against the eight degrees outside when I was there. The tv had a large range of channels, including BBC World and CNN. And here's a nice touch - they appear to have 'doctored' the sound so it can't be turned up too high and disturb other guests. There is a lobby bar, but the seating appears to be aimed more at groups than couples. The barman, like the other staff, was friendly. Location - the 100 bus stops outside, and that passes many or the city's tourist sights. It also takes you to Zoo station, where you can connect to the very frequent bus to the airport. This are both normal city buses, with no special fare. The Zoo is five minutes walk, and the main shopping area five minutes beyond that. I paid a quite ridiculous 98 Euros for two nights. Breakfast was 10 and worth every Eurocent, and 24 hours wifi in the room costs 5. There are also two free terminals off of the lobby. What is wrong with the hotel? Nothing, unless you get a hot room in the summer. One final point - one reviewer - WailengP - is confused and seems to think the hotel is the former DDR. It is not.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay there again ...”
Reviews.Author: WailengP
Reviews.Content: Amazingly, being the former DDR, the staff speak excellent English as oppose to some service staff I met in 'west Germany'. The breakfast is of superb quality, staff were happy to serve me my regular double espresso without extra charge. Room windows can be opened, so on a warm day, the fresh air is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Scags217
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Hotel Sylter Hof Berlin . It was a nice hotel in a nice location. The staff was extremly friendly. The front desk people were more than happy to help you. We went there on our honeymoon and the gentleman at the front desk upgraded us for free to a suite. I thought that was really nice. The breakfast was really good! The room was like an apartment . Very big. Like I said he upgraded us to a suite on the 10th floor. Hotel was very clean.As well as the rooms. I give this hotel from a scale of 10 an 8. I would def stay here again. The price was right. The location was good. 7 min walk to the zoo, 5 min walk to KADEWE (shopping mall) . Brandenburg gate was about a 35 min walk .No big deal. You could take the bus 100 in front of the hotel and it drops you off in front of the Brandenburg Tor. It also goes along Uder de linden. I think a Transit day pass cost us 4 euro each a day. Now the CONS: Not to many ,but worth saying. If you come in the summer be aware there is no air conditioning in the rooms . It got pretty warm at night the room. I had to open the windows. The hotel only has 2 computers for guest to go on and it was sometimes hard to get to, because someone almost everytime we passed by was on it. Wi-fi was a charge as-well . Overall I loved the hotel and we will def go back the next time we are in Berlin permitting the price is right. Again the staff there was great!

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Zwergnase
Reviews.Content: Very small room.very good breakfast bufett, friendly stuff, great location. Noise from traffic, no AC, it gets warm in the room in summer.

Reviews.Title: “We loved - as usual”
Reviews.Author: balooAarhus_Denmark
Reviews.Content: We spent our hollidays at Sylter Hof - the fourth time. The staff are always kindly and serviceminded. The rooms clean and comfortable and the breakfast can you find better. Sylter Hof is always a garantee for good days in the wonderfull city Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, well centered, Greate bar man!!”
Reviews.Author: Stefasemota
Reviews.Content: I find this including the price rate perfect for a 5 day stay in Berlin. The bar man's cocktails are perfect and the brunch breakfast serves you for the day! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alice-Michael
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Sylter Hof on our first trip to Berlin and were extremely satisfied with every aspect of it. Upon arriving, we were informed that we had been upgraded to a suite on the top floor of the hotel and were more than pleased to discover it contained a large sitting room, double bedroom and wonderful en-suite bathroom. Our room was clean, spacious and with a good view over the city. We found the location to be good; however Berlin is a large city and there is an awful lot to see. The KaDeWe was close by (which you can easily spend a whole day in) as was the Kaiser-Wilhelm Memorial Church. We ended up walking through the Tiergarten, which was absolutely beautiful in November, and to the Brandenburger Tor and Berliner Dom. We would only recommend this for others who don't mind long walks (it took us a good hour each way) but if walking isn't your thing, there is a bus stop around the corner from the hotel. We found the Sylter Hof to be comfortable, clean and great value for money. Would definitely recommend for most travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: jsergiocosta
Reviews.Content: As I work in the Hotel industry what made me write this review was the attitude of the staff, especially the Front Office. Nothing was ever much trouble, from explaning over and over directions, to call a taxi and to actually volunteer to make a reservation to a restaurant of my own choice. It goes against the stereotype that Germans are cold not friendly. This made a difference and any time I have to travel to Berlin I will make sure this is the Hotel of my choice. Just one detail. Please change the lighting over the computer keyboards. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: Toshipia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sylter Hof has everything you want for a pleasent stay in Berlin. Clean rooms with good bath, both tub and shower. The staff is very helpfull and speaks English. The breakfast is perfect with both hot and cold dishes. Location is also perfect and in reach of all the main turist attractions either by walk or tram. Only thing you should be aware of is that there is some traffic noice from the street, so get a room away from it if possible. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location hotel with warm service”
Reviews.Author: misty1983
Reviews.Content: this hotel is well located, only walk 10mins, u could reach shopping center, and in front of hotel, there is bus 100, could take u to most sightseeing places. the stuff is helpful for travellers on how to get to a scene. the breakfast is nice with a lot of bread, milk, coffee, fruits,etc. i am quite satisfied with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “not really”
Reviews.Author: Dragos68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 nights in April. The room was very small for 2 people and the hotel needs definitely some renovations soon. The carpets were full of stain. The bathroom was awful for 3 star hotel in Berlin. The location was very good but probably because of that was very loud as well. In the night it was almost impossible to sleep. The hotel staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “If you are booking a single room, look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: pinknoise
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest room I have ever rented anywhere. The clock radio mounted next to the bed looked like it was 30 years old. The time was wrong and the button to set the time was broken. The paint on the furniture was old and peeling off. The TV was also very old. The room was hot. The bed was very narrow. The bedding was just minimal. No colored bed spread, just a plain white duvet and sheet. Only one pillow that squashed completely flat under my head. They only provided one regular sized towel, one floor towel and one hand towel -- no body sized towel. I've never been in a hotel that provided only one towel. Usually you get multiple and larger towels. Breakfast and internet were added fees. It was not possible to use my iPhone and my laptop on the wireless internet at the same time. I could only log in with one at a time. In all, my room was more like a youth hostel than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near the Kurfürstedam”
Reviews.Author: balooAarhus_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, service and very friendly personal. The breakfast was suberb. Everything was perfekt !!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem within a handy distance of central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Hamster245
Reviews.Content: What a gem this hotel turned out to be. I found it on Expedia and was convinced to try it as the reviews seemed fair, and the price was very good. It also appeared to be in a good location. We were not disappointed, the hotel is 5 mins walk to Wittenburgerplatz U-Bahn station, and has bus stops right outside for the 100 bus service which runs from the Zoo through the heart of the city to Alexanderplatz very frequently. No need for a hire car here. The area around the hotel was very pleasant and although there was an erotic bar not far away, the area was far from seedy even late at night, in fact the neighbourhood seemed quiet. There were restaurants on the street, several shops including a small supermarket opposite and restaurants in the Wittenburgerplatz Square. A decent meal or places to have a drink were never far away. The Zoo was 10 mins walk, and the area around central Kurftendam 10-15 mins walk at most. Our room was clean, of a decent standard and with all the comforts we wanted. A clean bathroom with decent shower. Two comfortable beds, decent sized room and wardrobes. There was a TV which was not a Pay TV (unless you wanted certain types of movies) and most of the free stuff was of course in German, anyway we didn’t come to Berlin to watch TV all day. Minibars in the room a little pricey, but you don’t have to rely on it as there are plenty of nearby shops. Room was hot but had large opening windows and a table fan provided so it was manageable. We didn’t take the breakfast buffet at 10 euros, and it was noted that the price had been dropped already. We used the bakery/café on the corner one morning for fresh coffee and pastries (under 5 euros for two people) and on other days we used a delightful bar in Wittenburgerplatz called Noah’s which opened for breakfast early and did a very nice scrambled egg & bacon breakfast for 5 euros. We also had a very tasty evening meal here one evening and I’d recommend it if you are the sort of person who doesn’t want to depend on whatever the hotel provides. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the hotel clean, quiet and in good order. The neighbourhood pleasant and the location/transport connections as good as I could have asked for. Ok it isn’t the best hotel in the world but I recommend it strongly for location, price and a basic level of comfort and quality combined. If I could return to Berlin again, I’d be making sure I booked in here again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP MARKS ESPECIALLY FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE AND SECURITY, CLEANLINESS, VALUE, LOCATION, ROOM SPACIOUSNESS”
Reviews.Author: jackie662010
Reviews.Content: Spent four days mid week at Sylterhof. Customer service was very good and staff on the reception desk are very security conscious and polite, with most speaking enough English to overcome any language difficulties for those without German. Hotel was clean and bright. We had a junior suite on the 10th floor. Spacious room, nicely decorated with mahogany furniture. Bath had a shower head unit over it and it was a bit on the squashed side when the shower curtain was pulled across. But that was just a little niggly issue. Good storage for clothes, 2 leather chairs and a round table in addition to bed. Kitchen area was unfortunately obsolete as there were no utensils for using with the facilities (kitchen sink, cupboards, cooker, fridge) without paying extra. It did have a fridge which was great for keeping drinks cool and making icecubes. There was no air conditioning in the room (at 35 degrees, this would have been beneficial), however, a desk top fan was provided. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room. It was a quiet, relaxhing hotel atmosphere. Breakfast on site was 10 EUROS per person, with a wide range of buffet style options and in pleasant surroundings. However, we tended to use the cafe/restaurant next door (immediately to the left when coming out of hotel) which had a sun garden at the back and where breakfast was 5 euros. Avoid the English Breakfast though as it's not the traditional one that we know and love in the UK - it came with butter beans not baked beans! The room doesn't have the flowers in the base etc as is in the photo of the hotel online, and no chocolates on the pillows but all in all, it was very good value for money, in a good location, with good service and clean. Location was good - five minutes walk to the Wurtemburg Platz station (U2 line) and about ten minutes walk from the Zoo station. Some comments got us worried on other websites with talk of Kurfurstenstrasse being 'red light' area. There were a few thai massage shop premises and an erotic maze labyrinth around but what ever activity went on must have gone on behind closed doors, because we didn't see any thing of concern and it certainly wasn't a seedy area. If going to Berlin again, would have no hesitation in staying at Sylterhof again and it would be suitable for couples and for families. On a historical note, we found out that the site of the hotel used to house a building that was the STASI headquarters where the chief developed the strategy for deportation of Jews (transit and locations). All in all, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: RonNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is friendly, convenient to major shopping (including KaDeWe) and serves one of the best breakfast buffets around. The #100 bus is right outside the hotel which can take you to all the major sights in the city. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: berzini
Reviews.Content: As always it depends on the price you are being offered. At 60eur a night for a double it was a great choice. The location was a strong 8/10 - 5min from U-bahn and about 15 meters (yes, meters) from a very useful 100 Bus that can take you more or less throughout the center of the city. The hotel itself was good - very friendly stuff, free map, willing to help and explain. The rooms though could have been a little better. A solid 6,5-7 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....but there are better hotels around !!!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBerlin
Reviews.Content: Solo traveller in single room -- don't take your cat as it will get a headache !!!. The room was clean but very...very hot with no air con. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room and only a pay-TV. The room wasn't cleaned one day. It appears that alot of the single rooms are street facing which is busy 4 lane road - the noise is not masked by the glazing and importantly safes are room dependent....not in single rooms, however did get a box at reception. The problem with this is access was when it was convenient to the Reception staff !!!!......alot of waiting around and coming back later. The location is good and there is a supermarket opposite but I would not recomend this hotel or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: anibani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. Found the hotel room very clean and spacious. My only complaint was the road noise which the closed windows did not block out. Nothing a good pair of earplugs can't solve. It was very good value for 35 euros on a Sunday night. The location is excellent, walking distance to the Wittenbergplatz station. There is also a bus stop just in front of the hotel for Bus 100, which stops at many interesting sites in the middle of the city (museum island, brandenburg gate, reichstag) and ends at Alexanderplatz. The staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near amenities & metro at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsNSharks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Tiergarten area which is a nice area. There are lots of shops, cafes & restaurants nearby, which is the area of Wittenbergplatz & Zoologischer Garten. We stayed in the single room, which is of decent size and very good price (paid about GBP55/night on Opodo). Breakfast not included but there are lots in the Wittenbergplatz area at good prices. Rooms are comfortable, not the most modern deco but at the price you can't complain! Bathroom is clean and adequate too.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: welshpixie28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a buiness trip, but had my12year old daughter with me. The check in was easy with very friendly staff ( epsecially Inga), we had booked room only but were offered breakfast and a reduction for my daughter. The room was spotlessly clean and serviced daily, the breakfast was great with plenty of choice. The final night our feet had given up and there was no problem with us taking food up to our room. Overall it is a good hotel in agreat location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Sylter Hof”
Reviews.Author: chuncey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sylter Hof for 3 nights from 28 June to 1 July. We flew in from Liverpool Airport with Easyjet to Schonefeld. We took the S Bahn (less than 3 Euros) from the airport to the Zoologischer Garten, then a cab which was about 5 Euros from the station to the hotel. We found Sylter Hof convenient for the S Bahn/U Bahn and the centre of West Berlin. The rooms were clean and bright, on the smaller side but with plenty of closet space, desk, tv and the bathroom was clean and reasonably sized. It reminded me a bit of your average Holiday Inn or similar chain type hotel. We were greeted courteously by the check-in staff, who explained there had been a mix up over a request for non-feather bedding, but this was rectified straight away. The lobby and building style itself is a bit tired and 60's/70's looking but we found our room to be clean (apart from the disgusting, filthy, crusty remote control - maybe it's a bit of OCD but it was gross) if a little bit stuffy. There was a fan in the room which we made good use of, but I would certainly say this hotel would benefit massively from A/C. The facilities list use of an ironing board but you have to obtain a key from reception and use the iron in the housekeepers store room We were on the 6th floor but found that there was quite a lot of road noise when the windows were open, even though we were at the back of the hotel. Fortunately myself and my boyfriend are used to road noise so that didn't bother us too much, but if you are used to peace and quiet you will probably have difficulty sleeping here and have to make a decision between heat or noise. In the mornings there was noise coming from construction at the back of the hotel. We found the location great for exploring the old West, it is kind of on the border of south Tiergarten and Kurfurstendam. It is very close to the Europa Centre and the Zoo (don't go there, all the animals are in $hitty small enclosures and are going stir crazy, if you like animals and care about animal welfare this is not the place for you, don't give them your money and look at what PETA have to say about them). Anyway, I digress, the department store KaDeWe is about a 5/10 minute walk away towards the back of the hotel, so if you go down any of the side streets either side of the hotel you can get there really easy. This is located on Wittenbergplatz (I think), there were numerous cafes, bars and restaurants in this area as well as the U Bahn, which is only a few stops away from Potsdamer Platz. Potsdamer Platz is actually about a 30 minute walk away and there are numerous shops, bars, cafes and restaurants there and you can go via the diplomatic area, where all the embassies are clustered, and the attractions of the Kulturforum. Once you are at Potsdamer Platz the Reichstag, the Holocaust memorial and the Brandenburg Gate are within walking distance. Unfortunately we were there during the Germany vs Spain football game and most of this area was closed off for the football fans and the team homecoming. Berlin on the whole struck me as a very safe and clean place to go, even the football fans were civilised and instead of a riot ensuing when Spain won, Spanish supporters were given pats on the back, hi-fives etc! There is lots to see and and do in Berlin, my only regret is that we didn't spend longer there and see more of the East, we went on a bus tour (which we picked up on the Ku'Damm) but this didn't really give us the chance to explore the East properly. I would recommend this hotel as it is clean and a decent place to crash at the end of a long day, it is basic and comfortable but as I said, the lack of A/C and an excess of road noise, combined with ongoing construction at the back does let it down. Also I can't imagine any breakfast being worth 12 Euros or whatever they were charging, I would recommend going to a cafe on Wittenbergplatz. Also, it worked out cheaper to book it through expedia than direct with the hotel, it cost us £196.95 for 3 nights, including fees/taxes. My word of warning would be ordering a cab for your journey home, the hotel ordered us one from the local stand. The driver had a 'selective' english vocabulary and blatantly took us to the wrong train station which cost twice what it would have done had he taken us to the correct one (we asked for the Zoologischer Garten but he took us to the Hauptbahnof). He ignored the fact we were telling him he was going the wrong way and locked our suitcases in the boot of his car when we refused to pay as he was ripping us off! If we were to go back I would make sure the driver clearly understood the destination so there was no room for excuses, but I guess you will get rogue taxi drivers who make their living ripping off tourists wherever you go in the world. Stay here once and explore the West then go back and explore the East. Enjoy Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for Short Stays Only”
Reviews.Author: Rajiv_Anu
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 double rooms for a weekend stay in Berlin for ourselves and my parents visiting us. Was pleasantly suprised to be upgrade to the Suites (both rooms). This was in the 14th floor. The rooms was huge with an attached kitchen and small eating area. Nevertheless they were musty and smelt of having not been occupied for a long time. The hotel is close to the center of West Berlin. We travelled by car, so was not a problem with this. We avoided the expensive breakfast as there are some nice cafes in the surroundings where one can have b'fast for half the cost. Overall satisfied for the 2 nights and 3 days we spent in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: lakie1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 1 night and I can tell you that it was horrible! I had a single room with a single bed. The bed was so tiny that I couldn't turn. I did not sleep the whole night because of the noice from the streets. The windows are really thin so you hear constantly cars, people etc. etc. It was 19 C that day but the room was like 30 C. There is NO airco so it was way too warm! My room smelt very dirty and the interior is really old. Berlin is a great city so dont let it be ruined by sleeping in this horrible place. I would not even recommend it to my worst enemy...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, pity about the staff”
Reviews.Author: Dowlins4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights at the end of a trip that had started in Estonia and made it's way through europe from there. Our flights were very cheap and we had previously been staying with friends so we splashed out on this hotel instead of going with the usual hostel or budget accommodation. Even though I loved the hotel I did feel that we weren't as welcome there as you would expect: When we arrived they tried to charge us a more expensive price than the one we had agreed when booking and after a bit of arguing and the print out of our booking confirmation they finally backed down however they were then very strict about getting payment up front off us even though they had my credit card details. The waiting staff in the breakfast room were rude and on one occasion when we came down for breakfast they refused us telling us that we had already had breakfast that day and again we had to argue the truth before they realised that there was a mistake on their records. Despite all of this I'd still give the hotel 4 out of 5, as the rooms are beautiful, clean and spacious and the breakfast was delicious and had such a great selection. The location too is great (very close to the Zoo) and allows you to reach all the top attractions by the nearby train station (the public transport is great in Berlin). Berlin is a great, and the rest of the Berlin people we met were lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel - Berlin is lovely !”
Reviews.Author: pami.eire
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that Berlin is a a lovely place for a weekend break, it exceeded my expectations ,its modern , clean and so handy to get around on the trains or bus . People are generally very friendly and the hotel is only a ten minute walk from the Zoo and many bars and restaurants . The hotel itself is fairly unimpressive , rooms are adequate and functional - the beds are so comfy I didnt want to get up ! - but its very reasonably priced so its great for the price I enjoyed it overall .

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Boutye
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day city break in Berlin and we had a great time, found the hotel (pronounced zoolterhof) in venere.com Getting there from Schonefeld Airport was quite easy ,and enjoyable, the RE7 express to the station at the zoo and then the bus 100 (3 stops)right to the door of the hotel (fare 2.10 euros each from the airport!- magic! We were made to feel very welcome on our arrival - I was a bit embarresed by not being able to speak German, but everyone could speak English Our room was on the 5th floor , nice and bright ,spacious and clean, we liked the little bag of Haribo Bears on the bed each evening. We did not eat at the hotel as I had heard breakfast was expensive , instead we had breakfast at a local cafe /take a way just round the corner and also at a kiosk at Wittenbergplatz station about 400m away. For dinner we discovered a great local restaurant 2 streets away in Bayreutherstrasse called the Restaurant Berlinerchen- this was great and we had some great local cuisine. Travelling from the hotel could not have been easier, we used the bus 100 to get to the Kudamm, Reichstag, Under den linden, Alex - and also the U and S bahns and of course the Trams in the east of the city. The 3 things we enjoyed most (apart from shopping - the wife )was the Reichstag, the Berlin wall memorial at Bernaur strasse (close to Nordbanhof), and seeing the bust of Nefertiti at the Altes musuem To sum up we enjoyed a friendly, clean, well located hotel and we shall be staying there again when I run the Berlin marathon, oh yes check out the piece of the Berlin wall opposite the hotel at the Italian restaurant. Regards Bout ye aka the seeker of truth... and justice

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: victa65
Reviews.Content: At the end of my travels in Europe, I decided to book a Junior Suite at this hotel for 3 nights. I got a reasonably good rate by booking directly with Sylter-Hof. The room was enormous compared to my previous accommodation. This was to be expected since I was paying extra for a suite. It was very clean and well appointed. I had difficulty with the key entry on the second day and reported it to the front desk and it was fixed in good time. The reception staff spoke English and were very helpful. As mentioned often in the reviews here, the tourist 100 bus stops outside the hotel and is very convenient for visiting the sights of Berlin. A definite plus. The front desk sells bus tickets. The internet is available on a PC near the lobby via a credit card. There is a cafe next door and the meals are perfectly fine. There is a large variety of selections for breakfast. It is buffet style so you can eat all you want. It`s very close to Kurfurstendamm and all the shops. Especially, KaDeWe which was celebrating its 100th birthday when I visited. I spent ages wandering in the food hall. Its location is excellent. It is a well run establishment and I would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, old rooms...”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: It will be a short review (as I only spend one short night there before changing hotel). Basically, either they have two different types of rooms (old and new) or then I can't understand some of the other reviews. The hotel itself is old, the rooms are old and small (but kinda clean), the bed is small and it was hot in the room. I felt like being in an average London hotel. For 85EUR/night you can get better deals in Berlin. The only positive thing I can say is that the people at the reception were welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ayejay
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading reviews, but found the reality of the hotel somewhat lacking. The room was very basic and small and had not been cleaned very well there were still crumbs on the table. The worst bit was no airconditioning, the room was hot and stuffy despite having the windows open. There was only a heavy duvet on the bed which made sleeping uncomfortable and the pillows were feather so no matter how many you had you got no support. There was nothing in the Pay TV to cater for english speakers and no warning that it was all in german before committing to the cost. Glasses that I used during my stay were never washed and the room was never cleaned well. They advertise a hotel restaurant but it is never open, which means that you have to go elsewhere to eat. There was a rough crowd hanging around the hotel at night making a lot of noise into the small hours. The front desk were not much help when enquiring about tours and excursions so had to find those myself in the city. Overall I feel it was not worth the money I spent, in no way would I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place”
Reviews.Author: Trygdordningen
Reviews.Content: The location and standard is quite brilliant, especially if you don't want to spent too money on hotels. Only a short walk from Bahnhof Zoo. There is a bus stopp right outside the hotel. The bus takes you directly to Alexanderplatz. Really friendly staff, and they speak English. The single rooms are just beside a street with rather a lot of traffic. So if you are a light sleeper, like me, be sure to book room as high up as possible. The doubles are probably much more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable, kind”
Reviews.Author: MsInformation
Reviews.Content: This a 3*+ with some great service above and beyond the call. A very handy location for public transport, shopping and a few good value "neighbourhood" restaurants and bars - and pretty nicely furnished. I had friends staying at the same time so even though we were upgraded for our seven nights (no extra charge) to a junior suite I still saw the double style room we might have had and thought it seemed well planned and comfortable. Being in the suite end was quieter. The newer tower by the restaurant filled up with coachloads of guests - sometimes noisy school trips. Hubby fell ill on our 2nd day and the reception staff found us medical help, gave lots of good advice and kept an eye on him for the rest of the trip. Housekeeping were diligent and high standard, the mini bar was well stocked and reflected local shop prices. Tried the restaurant first morning/afternoon for buffet lunch - very dull and not great value - never tried breakfast or the hotel coffee shop. Great bakery/coffee bar round the corner on Keithstrasse. We paid £50/night for a double and got excellent accomodation and service. 90% of the staff we met embarrassed me with their excellent English thank goodness - my German's still not too good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davidwebster300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sylter Hof for New Year. My friends had a double room and I had a single. My room overlooked the main road and wasnt noisy at all. Only thing was, the window let in a draught so I had to keep wrapped up at night but that wasn't too bothersome. The location of the hotel was great and it is very well connected. There are a number of stations nearby but we preferred the 15 min walk up to the Zoo Garden as that station takes you pretty much anywhere. If you dont fancy the walk up there, you can get the bus from across the road straight up the station. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel, or you can head down to Nollendorfplatz where there are some lovely restaurants. There is a really good Creole one (can't remember what it's called) which is a must-go!!! All in all, had a very pleasant stay at the Sylter Hof and wouldn't hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Firlebeacon
Reviews.Content: I spent 15 days in Berlin over Easter 2007. I chose the hotel having read the reviews on TripAdvisor and on the basis of a recommendation by a family member. I was not disappointed. Staff was helpful and acommodating. The location was perfect (for me). The buffet breakfast was good and items consistently replenished. On the basis of comments by previous reviewers I booked a "double room for single use" which gave me a bit more space than the single room and paid 69 Euro's per night including breakfast, which considering that it was over a holiday period was not bad, especially since a lot of the other hotels in my price range were booked up. Also based on comments from previous reviewers I asked for a quiet non-smoking room and was given a room at the back which was blissfully quiet (aside from the morning chorus from the birds). The only problem I had was at the end of the stay when some noisy travellers had booked several rooms on my floor, however after a call to reception all was quiet. I was a single mature woman travelling alone. I would thorougly recommend this hotel to others and would definitely stay there again should I return to Berlin. Thank you TripAdvisor reviewers for your helpful comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jimbob_uk
Reviews.Content: We left it quite late booking a hotel for new year and stumbled across this one. We chose it mainly because it was not too expensive and in a good location. Considering this we were very pleased with the hotel when we arrived. We booked with booking.com and got a rate including breakfast for a junior suite. It was only 10 euros more a night for a suite so it seemed worth it. The suite was massive with a fantastic lounge with leather sofas and a view over the western side of Berlin. It was on the 15th floor (of 16) which is higher than most buildings in Berlin. The room was a bit warm but we found the thermostat for the radiators and managed to sort it out. We found the pillows a bit thin - we asked at reception and they brought us some more within half an hour. The whole suite was very clean and in good condition. As previous reviewers have mentioned, the 100 bus goes from outside which passes a lot of the main sights. It's about a 5 minute walk to Wittenbergplatz which has an underground and some good restaurants. The Zoo station is about 10 minutes walk away, this has trains to Potsdam for the castles there and in the other direction to other areas of the city. All in all we had a great holiday and I wouldn't change a thing about where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: kristofer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights starting new year's eve. All staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was basic and clean. The location is good, walking distance to zoo and Kurfürstendamm, buss no 100 stops right outside the entrance and take you to Alexanderplatz via many of the big sights in the centre. The hotel (not all rooms though) faces a busy road, it didn't disturb us, but beware if you're a light sleeper. Don't pay for the boring €13 breakfast, there's a coffee-shop next to the lobby. All in all, our experience is a friendly, good located hotel with great value (we paid ~€40 per night for a double).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shirbaz
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at this hotel for three nights, our reason for visiting Berlin was to see the Christmas Markets. The hotel is on a busy main road, however once in the hotel you could not hear the traffic. The hotel is in a great location about a ten minute walk to the main shopping area, the hotel is very clean and comfortable and the rooms are cosy - if a little too warm! The reception and bar area is really nice, with nice big comfy sofas - it does however get a bit busy with people meeting there before their evening meal, but not too much of a problem. The number 100 bus stops right outside the hotel and for €2.10 you can travel the whole of the city. Berlin is beautiful and very big so the bus is great to get around, the hotel is also only a 10 minute walk to the zoo. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, the staff are really helpful and friendly and nothing too much trouble. We did not have the breakfast which is €13 but you can go next door and get a great breakfast for €5. If you stay in Berlin try this hotel I am sure you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mktraveller
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We arrived at almost midnight, but the staff were very helpful. The room was a suite and had two beds in the main room and two more in the ante room. There was plenty of shelf space in the bathroom. Breakfast was €13 but we ate 200 metres down the road for €5. There was so much space in the room, it reminded me of a Shangri-La hotel. We were in Berlin when the plot to blow up planes from London was discovered. The staff looked up everything for us on the web and couldn't have been more helpful. We loved the small packs of Gummi Bears by the bed each night, a nice change from chocolates. Any quibbles? Only two. No face cloths in the bathroom and no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Apart from that it was great, plenty of room and the 100 bus right outside the door. and all we paid was €79 a night. Next time I'm in Berlin I'm coming here, it's so much nicer than the Swissotel, that we stayed in last time. Don't believe the star rating it's much better than a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DerylDowling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8th May,2006 for 3 nights. Upon arrival we were greeted like we were the only people to ever stay here. Her name was Inga and she was excellent told us all about Berlin and the Hotel and what was near by. The hotel is in a great location close to a big shopping centre and a lot of cafes. The hotel itself was the best value hotel in our whole 42 days in Europe. It was very clean excellent bathrooms, large widows that you can open to let fresh air in and also dry underwear and socks, the beds were very comfortable and there were also lifts. As we said this was the cheapist hotel we paid for and was one of the best. When we go back we would stay there again, big thanks to the staff in particular Inga. Deryl & Fiona Dowling Tasmania Australia

Reviews.Title: “Super value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sylter Hof for four days during the World Cup as one of a party of seven. Our group booked one double and two triples. The double was fairly pokey but the 10th floor triples were extremely spacious. The triples were described as suites and indeed had a large seating area and a separate kitchen which had a sink, cupboards, fridge & table. However, for some strange reason, the kitchen was devoid of pots, pans & crockery! It was very hot during our stay and the lack of air con was a problem at night, although a large fan was provided. The hotel has a very pleasant lobby, is centrally located, very quiet and extremely good value over the internet at 180 euro per night for a triple room, excluding breakfast. I would definitely pay a bit extra for a triple. Plenty of places nearby to get breakfast for about 7 euro. Overall the staff were friendly, courteous and very efficient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good central base in Berlin and a bit of comfort on a modest budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: StuartJG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sylter Hof for 3 night Break.Superb location in quiet area, nice people.Great value. Booked on internert Average 73 Euros a night. almost 50% of Rack rate. Breakfast extra at 13 Euros, which we gave a miss. Plenty of Cafes etc within short distance. Hotel had great coffee bar which also served a very good breakfast a little cheaper.On check in we were upgraded to Apartment room on 14th floor with amazing views of Berlin,particually at night. Dedicated lift to apartments and suites. Room was huge, very nice furniture and decoration. Staff very friendly and helpful always remembered room number without asking.Nice bar area. Hotel Restaurant not open in the evenings we were there.Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. Good Italian opposite and excellent Fish restaurant 2 minute walk. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.Good secure left luggage room for late departures etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, efficient, friendly, knowledgeable and polyglot. Excellent breakfast, well-located and good value for its high standards in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brzlian1
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hotel Sylter Hof. It offers good accommodation for an affordable price. The location is great, within walking distance from the Zoo Bahnhof (about 10 minutes walking) and only 3 blocks from major subway lines. Not to mention the 100 bus that stops right in front of the hotel. I stayed at one of their suites in 2006. The bedroom, bathroom and kitchen were sparkling clean. The bedroom had three large windows that opened plus a forth one in the kitchen. The kitchen was spacious, much larger than most kitchens in New York City, and it had a stove with an oven and a small refrigerator but no utensils, pans or plates. The staff was very friendly and everyone spoke at least three languages, including English. The hotel also has a Coffee Shop, which serves simple and cheap food. The things I didn’t like about the hotel: 1.Apparently there is no such thing as a non-smoking room. Although I had requested a non-smoking room and was given one in a non-smoking floor with non-smoking signs all over, the smell was overwhelming. From the pillows to the curtains, everything smelled cigarette smoke. It took two days with all the windows open during the day for the smell to go away. By then, all my clothing, even the ones inside the bags, smelled bad. 2.The rooms have no air-conditioning. I stayed there during the winter months, so I didn’t need air-conditioning but I wouldn’t stay there during the summer. The windows are sound proof and the traffic noise from the two large avenues that surround the building were of no concern. However, the noise was quite loud with the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Rex Reuter, I can't thank you enough”
Reviews.Author: deechaToronto
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, I would have to say that I have never experienced a more seamless, professional hotel stay. Upon check-in, we were greeted with the utmost respect, having everything waiting for us - room key (which I should mention was emblazoned with the finest gold), fresh towels, and a personal letter written by Rex himself. Our room was exactly what we ordered, with arguably the best kitchen facilities I have seen this side of the eastern block. The staff provided us a cot at no extra charge and without a hassle. And the bar - words can't express how great it was. The very attractive waitress made it her duty to make sure my friend and I had the best experience possible. The endless choices of drinks and the fabulous clientele (especially the Finns that we met) added to our experience. Rex - you should be proud of your role in making us some of the happiest hotel guests in the world. The service you and your staff provide was worthy of other's emulation. Rex is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyAM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the Berlinale Film Festival. I had a single room, which some might find small but suited my needs perfectly. The room was very clean and well kept. What I loved most about this hotel was the location. The 100 bus, which takes you past the Reichstag and onto unter den Linden, stops right outside the hotel. Kurfurstendamm (major shopping street) and Bahnhof Zoolischer Garten is about a 15 minute walk. The department store KaDeWe was right around the corner. It was especially handy for the film festival as there were two theatres within walking distance. The breakfast buffet was a little steep at 13 euros a pop, but it was plentiful and I liked it. There is also a resonably priced cafe adjacent to the hotel, a grocery store across the street for self caterers. The staff are very helpful. I love this city, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: arend
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Sylter Hof in Berlin from 4 until 8 october 2005. Rooms and service are good. However, as the hotel is situated on the busy and noisy Kurfürsterstrasse, it is preferable to book a room with windows on the backside. As breakfast in the hotel is rather expensive, we had our daily breakfast in a very good coffee shop next door to the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sylter Hof
HotelInfo.Address: Kurfuerstenstrasse 114-116, 10787 Berlin, Germany
